node.title: At least 19 dead, including 9 children, in Bronx apartment fire, officials say
node.alt: The fire started just before 11 a.m. in a duplex apartment on the second and third floors of the building on East 181st Street, officials said.
node.description: Mayor Eric Adams said the fire was one of the worst in the city “during modern times.”
node.content: ["At least 19 people, including nine children, were killed in a fire in a Bronx apartment building on Sunday morning, according to a city official who was not authorized to speak publicly, in what officials described as one of the city\u2019s worst fires in recent memory.", "The fire started just before 11 a.m. in a duplex apartment on the second and third floors of the building, on East 181st Street, according to the Fire Department. ", "Firefighters arrived within three minutes and encountered smoke that extended the entire height of the 19-story building, said the fire commissioner, Daniel A. Nigro.", "He added that \u201cthe smoke conditions in this building were unprecedented,\u201d and that victims had suffered from severe smoke inhalation.", "Crews entering the building found victims \u201con every floor\u201d and were taking them out in \u201ccardiac and respiratory arrest,\u201d he said.", "\u201cThe numbers are horrific,\u201d Mayor Eric Adams said at a news conference on Sunday afternoon, adding, \u201cThis is going to be one of the worst fires that we have witnessed during modern times.\u201d"]
